31#ifndef OPENSSL_HEADER_DIRECTORY_H
32#define OPENSSL_HEADER_DIRECTORY_H
33
34#include <openssl/base.h>
35
36#if defined(__cplusplus)
37extern "C" {
38#endif
39
40
41/* Directory functions abstract the O/S specific operations for opening and
42 * reading directories in the filesystem. */
43
44
45/* OPENSSL_dir_context_st is an opaque structure that represents an open
46 * directory and a position in that directory. */
47typedef struct OPENSSL_dir_context_st OPENSSL_DIR_CTX;
48
49/* OPENSSL_DIR_read reads a single filename from |ctx|. On the first call,
50 * |directory| must be given and |*ctx| must be NULL. Subsequent calls with the
51 * same |*ctx| will return subsequent file names until it returns NULL to
52 * indicate EOF. The strings returned reference a buffer internal to the
53 * |OPENSSL_DIR_CTX| and will be overridden by subsequent calls. */
54OPENSSL_EXPORT const char *OPENSSL_DIR_read(OPENSSL_DIR_CTX **ctx,
55 const char *directory);
56
57/* OPENSSL_DIR_end closes |*ctx|. It returns one on success and zero on
58 * error. */
59OPENSSL_EXPORT int OPENSSL_DIR_end(OPENSSL_DIR_CTX **ctx);
60
61
62#if defined(__cplusplus)
63} /* extern C */
64#endif
65
66#endif /* OPENSSL_HEADER_DIRECTORY_H */
67
